definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: The moment the son was about to go aboard the ship, they kissed good-bye with tears.
sentences.chinese: 在儿子即将上船的时刻，他们含泪吻别。

sentences.english: I and you kiss goodbye in nobody's street, lets the wind laugh at me not to be able crazily to reject.
sentences.chinese: 我和你吻别在无人的街，让风痴笑我不能拒绝。

sentences.english: I even occasionally kiss away from home.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至偶尔在离家的时候吻别。

sentences.english: The moment the son was about to go aboard ship , they kissed good - bye with tears.
sentences.chinese: 孩子马上就要登上去国外的船，他们挥泪吻别。

sentences.english: Connie kissed Carlo good-bye when he put her in the limousine .
sentences.chinese: 当卡罗送康妮上车时，她也只好同他吻别了。

sentences.english: As Sandra kissed her husband goodbye, they both cried.
sentences.chinese: 当桑德拉吻别丈夫的时候，所有人都哭了。

sentences.english: The captain stuck the fork into the potato then they kissed goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 船长把饭叉戳进土豆，然后他们吻别了。

sentences.english: Kissing him good-bye earned you extra credit.
sentences.chinese: 跟他吻别能得到附加的学分。

sentences.english: This guy breached security to give his girlfriend a good-bye kiss at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人在机场越过警戒线，吻别他的女朋友。

sentences.english: Ellen kissed her younger brother good-bye and hugged Sally gently.
sentences.chinese: 埃伦吻别了弟弟，并温柔地拥抱了萨莉。

definition: Jacky Cheung or Hok Yau Jacky (1961-), Cantopop and film star
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
Sandy Lam (1966-), Hong Kong pop singer
Eason Chan (1974-), Hong Kong pop singer and actor
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
